text: The Lamnidae are the family of mackerel sharks known as white sharks. They are large, fast-swimming predatory fish found in oceans worldwide. The name of the family is formed from the Greek word lamna, which means "fish of prey", and was derived from the Greek legendary creature, the Lamia.: A source-book of biological names and terms, 1944, Edmund Carroll Jaeger == References == Category:Sharks
title: Lamnidae
